Title: anyrange @> anyrange
Description: Does the first range contain the second?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange @> anyelement
Description: Does the range contain the element?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange <@ anyrange
Description: Is the first range contained by the second?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyelement <@ anyrange
Description: Is the element contained in the range?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange && anyrange
Description: Do the ranges overlap, that is, have any elements in common?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange << anyrange
Description: Is the first range strictly left of the second?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange >> anyrange
Description: Is the first range strictly right of the second?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange &< anyrange
Description: Does the first range not extend to the right of the second?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange &> anyrange
Description: Does the first range not extend to the left of the second?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange -|- anyrange
Description: Are the ranges adjacent?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange + anyrange
Description: Computes the union of the ranges. The ranges must overlap or be adjacent, so that the union is a single range (but see range_merge()).
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange * anyrange
Description: Computes the intersection of the ranges.
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange - anyrange
Description: Computes the difference of the ranges. The second range must not be contained in the first in such a way that the difference would not be a single range.
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange @> anymultirange
Description: Does the first multirange contain the second?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange @> anyrange
Description: Does the multirange contain the range?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange @> anyelement
Description: Does the multirange contain the element?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange @> anymultirange
Description: Does the range contain the multirange?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange <@ anymultirange
Description: Is the first multirange contained by the second?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange <@ anyrange
Description: Is the multirange contained by the range?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange <@ anymultirange
Description: Is the range contained by the multirange?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyelement <@ anymultirange
Description: Is the element contained by the multirange?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange && anymultirange
Description: Do the multiranges overlap, that is, have any elements in common?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange && anyrange
Description: Does the multirange overlap the range?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange && anymultirange
Description: Does the range overlap the multirange?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange << anymultirange
Description: Is the first multirange strictly left of the second?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange << anyrange
Description: Is the multirange strictly left of the range?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange << anymultirange
Description: Is the range strictly left of the multirange?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange >> anymultirange
Description: Is the first multirange strictly right of the second?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange >> anyrange
Description: Is the multirange strictly right of the range?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange >> anymultirange
Description: Is the range strictly right of the multirange?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange &< anymultirange
Description: Does the first multirange not extend to the right of the second?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange &< anyrange
Description: Does the multirange not extend to the right of the range?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange &< anymultirange
Description: Does the range not extend to the right of the multirange?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange &> anymultirange
Description: Does the first multirange not extend to the left of the second?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange &> anyrange
Description: Does the multirange not extend to the left of the range?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange &> anymultirange
Description: Does the range not extend to the left of the multirange?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange -|- anymultirange
Description: Are the multiranges adjacent?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange -|- anyrange
Description: Is the multirange adjacent to the range?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anyrange -|- anymultirange
Description: Is the range adjacent to the multirange?
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange + anymultirange
Description: Computes the union of the multiranges. The multiranges need not overlap or be adjacent.
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange * anymultirange
Description: Computes the intersection of the multiranges.
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators

Title: anymultirange - anymultirange
Description: Computes the difference of the multiranges.
Category: Range divide Multirange Functions and Operators
